intro: Bognera, commonly known as marsh carnation, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Montiaceae. These plants are characterized by their low-growing habit, with fleshy, succulent leaves that help them survive in moist, often nutrient-poor environments. The flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive central spur. Bognera thrives in wetlands, marshes, and other boggy areas, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
